vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/c7ef1ece-a170-42e6-80fc-86889073f6e7">USA</keyword>         <topcClas>Economic conditions and indicators - Economics</topcClas>         <topcClas>Science and technology</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>Main Science and Technology Indicators</i> database contains 151 main data series selected from the <i>Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) Scientific and Technological Indicators</i> database for 30 OECD member countries and nine non-member countries. The majority of these series provide information on research and experimental development resources, with additional series providing measures of output and the impact of scientific and technological activities. A number of economic series are also included to calculate indicators such as growth rates at fixed prices, research and development expenditures as a percentage of GDP or industrial value added, and series to convert data into a common currency using comparisons at purchasing power parities.<br> <br> These data were first provided by the UK Data Service in March 2004. The UK Data Service web site includes further information on its <i>OECD Main Science and Technology Indicators</i> holdings, including a <a href="http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/science-technology.aspx" title="OECD Main Science and Technology Indicators dataset user guide">dataset user guide</a> and details of <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/oecd/msti/2010-02" title="OECD Main Science and Technology Indicators latest database updates">latest database updates<a/>.<br> <br> <b>Citation:</b> The bibliographic citation for the database is: Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development ({YYYY}): Main Science and Technology Indicators ({Ed. Data download: YYYY-MM}). Mimas, University of Manchester. DOI: {edition specific doi - e.g. <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/oecd/msti/2010-02">http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/oecd/msti/2010-02</a>}. <br> <br> <b>Alternative DOIs:</b> <a href="http://www.oecd-ilibrary.org/science-and-technology/data/oecd-science-technology-and-r-d-statistics_strd-data-en" title="10.1787/strd-data-en">10.1787/strd-data-en</a> (to access via OECD.Stat subscription).<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The 151 indicators in the <i>Main Science and Technology</i> database come under the following subject headings (see the <a href="http://www.esds.ac.uk/international/support/user_guides/oecd/sti_manual.pdf" title ="OECD's Main Science and Technology Indicators manual (PDF)">OECD's MSTI manual</a> for further details):<ul><li>Gross Domestic Expenditure on Research and Development (GERD)</li><li>Research and Development Personnel (FTE)</li><li>GERD by source of funds</li><li>GERD by performance sectors<li>Researchers (Headcount)</li><li>Business Enterprise Expenditure on Research and Development (BERD)</li><li>Business Enterprise Research and Development Personnel (FTE)</li><li>BERD by source of funds</li><li>BERD by performance sectors</li><li>Higher Education Expenditure on Research and Development (HERD)</li><li>Higher Education Research and Development  Personnel (FTE)</li><li>Government Expenditure on Research and Development</li><li>Government Research and Development Personnel (FTE)</li><li>Government Budget Appropriations or Outlays for Research and Development by socio-economic objectives (GBAORD) <li>Research and Development Expenditure of Foreign Affiliates</li><li>Patents</li><li>Technology Balance of Payments (TBP)</li><li>International trade in highly Research and Development-intensive industries</li><li>Annex: Economic series</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd>The <i>OECD Main Science and Technology Indicators</i> database is updated six-monthly, and runs from 1981.</timePrd>         <nation>Multi-nation</nation>         <geogUnit>Countries</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Administrative units (geographical/political)</anlyUnit>         <universe>Cross-national; National</universe>         <universe>OECD member countries (30): Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Korea, Luxembourg, Mexico, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovak Republic, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, United Kingdom, United States. <br>Non-member countries (9): Argentina, China, Israel, Romania, Russian Federation, Singapore, Slovenia, Chinese Taipei and South Africa.</universe>
